briefdescription.para: Returns true if the plane can be used on the given output for its current repaint cycle.
Get output state to disable output.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a pointer to an output_state object which can be used to disable an output (e.g. DPMS off).

parameterdescription.para: The pending state object owning this update

simplesect.para: A drm_output_state to disable the output

memberdef.argsstring: (struct drm_output *output, uint32_t flags, unsigned int sec, unsigned int usec)
memberdef.name: drm_output_update_complete

briefdescription.para: Mark a drm_output_state (the output's last state) as complete.

detaileddescription.para: This handles any post-completion actions such as updating the repaint timer, disabling the output, and finally freeing the state.

briefdescription.para: Begin a new repaint cycle.

detaileddescription.para: Called by the core compositor at the beginning of a repaint cycle. Creates a new pending_state structure to own any output state created by individual output repaint functions until the repaint is flushed or cancelled.

briefdescription.para: Flush a repaint set.

detaileddescription.para: Called by the core compositor when a repaint cycle has been completed and should be flushed. Frees the pending state, transitioning ownership of the output state from the pending state, to the update itself. When the update completes (see drm_output_update_complete), the output state will be freed.

briefdescription.para: Cancel a repaint set.

detaileddescription.para: Called by the core compositor when a repaint has finished, so the data held across the repaint cycle should be discarded.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct drm_backend *b, const drmModePlane *kplane, struct drm_output *output, enum wdrm_plane_type type, uint32_t format)
memberdef.name: drm_plane_create

briefdescription.para: Create a drm_plane for a hardware plane.

detaileddescription.para: Creates one drm_plane structure for a hardware plane, and initialises its properties and formats.
In the absence of universal plane support, where KMS does not explicitly expose the primary and cursor planes to userspace, this may also create an 'internal' plane for internal management.
This function does not add the plane to the list of usable planes in Weston itself; the caller is responsible for this.
Call drm_plane_destroy to clean up the plane.

parameterdescription.para: DRM plane to create, or NULL if creating internal plane
Output to create internal plane for, or NULL
Type to use when creating internal plane, or invalid
Format to use for internal planes, or 0

memberdef.argsstring: (struct drm_backend *b, struct drm_output *output, enum wdrm_plane_type type)
memberdef.name: drm_output_find_special_plane

briefdescription.para: Find, or create, a special-purpose plane.

detaileddescription.para: Primary and cursor planes are a special case, in that before universal planes, they are driven by non-plane API calls. Without universal plane support, the only way to configure a primary plane is via drmModeSetCrtc, and the only way to configure a cursor plane is drmModeSetCursor2.
Although they may actually be regular planes in the hardware, without universal plane support, these planes are not actually exposed to userspace in the regular plane list.

However, for ease of internal tracking, we want to manage all planes through the same drm_plane structures. Therefore, when we are running without universal plane support, we create fake drm_plane structures to track these planes.

briefdescription.para: Destroy one DRM plane.

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a DRM plane, removing it from screen and releasing its retained buffers in the process. The counterpart to drm_plane_create.

briefdescription.para: Initialise sprites (overlay planes)

detaileddescription.para: Walk the list of provided DRM planes, and add overlay planes.
Call destroy_sprites to free these planes.

briefdescription.para: Clean up sprites (overlay planes)

detaileddescription.para: The counterpart to create_sprites.

briefdescription.para: Power output on or off.

detaileddescription.para: The DPMS/power level of an output is used to switch it on or off. This is DRM's hook for doing so, which can called either as part of repaint, or independently of the repaint loop.
If we are called as part of repaint, we simply set the relevant bit in state and return.
This function is never called on a virtual output.

briefdescription.para: Create a name given a DRM connector.

detaileddescription.para:
con
The DRM connector whose type and id form the name.
A newly allocate string, or NULL on error. Must be free()'d after use.
The name does not identify the DRM display device.

briefdescription.para: Pick a CRTC that might be able to drive all attached connectors.

parameterdescription.para: The output whose attached heads to include.

simplesect.para: CRTC object to pick, or NULL on failure or not found.

briefdescription.para: Create an "empty" drm_crtc.

detaileddescription.para: It will only set its ID, pipe and props. After all, it adds the object to the DRM-backend CRTC list.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a drm_crtc object that was created with drm_crtc_create().

detaileddescription.para: It will also remove it from the DRM-backend CRTC list.

briefdescription.para: Find all CRTCs of the fd and create drm_crtc objects for them.

detaileddescription.para: The CRTCs are saved in a list of the drm_backend and will keep there until the fd gets closed.

parameterdescription.para: The DRM resources, it is taken with drmModeGetResources

simplesect.para: 0 on success (at least one CRTC in the list), -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Populates scanout and cursor planes for the output.

detaileddescription.para: Also sets the topology of the planes by adding them to the plane stacking list.

briefdescription.para: The opposite of drm_output_init_planes().

detaileddescription.para: First of all it removes the planes from the plane stacking list. Then, in case we don't have support for universal planes it destroys the planes. After all it sets the planes of the output as NULL.

briefdescription.para: Pick a CRTC and reserve it for the output.

detaileddescription.para: On failure, the output remains without a CRTC.

parameterdescription.para: The output with no CRTC associated.

briefdescription.para: Release reservation of the CRTC.

detaileddescription.para: Make the CRTC free to be reserved and used by another output.

parameterdescription.para: The output that will release its CRTC.

memberdef.argsstring: (enum wdrm_content_protection_state protection, enum wdrm_hdcp_content_type type, enum weston_hdcp_protection *weston_protection)
memberdef.name: get_weston_protection_from_drm

briefdescription.para: Get current content-protection status for a given head.

parameterdescription.para: drm_head, whose protection is to be retrieved

simplesect.para: protection status in case of success, -1 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Replace connector data and monitor information.

detaileddescription.para:
connector
The drm_connector object to be updated.
conn
The connector data to be owned by the drm_connector, must match the current drm_connector ID.
0 on success, -1 on failure.
Takes ownership of connector on success, not on failure.

briefdescription.para: Update connector and monitor information.

detaileddescription.para:
head
The head to update.
conn
The DRM connector object.
0 on success, -1 on failure.
Updates monitor information and connection status. This may schedule a heads changed call to the user.
Takes ownership of connector on success, not on failure.

briefdescription.para: Update writeback connector.

detaileddescription.para:
writeback
The writeback to update.
conn
DRM connector object.
0 on success, -1 on failure.
Takes ownership of connector on success, not on failure.

briefdescription.para: Create a Weston head for a connector.

detaileddescription.para: Given a DRM connector, create a matching drm_head structure and add it to Weston's head list.

backend
Weston backend structure
conn
DRM connector object
drm_device
udev device pointer
0 on success, -1 on failure
Takes ownership of connector on success, not on failure.

briefdescription.para: Create a Weston output structure.

detaileddescription.para: Create an "empty" drm_output. This is the implementation of weston_backend::create_output.
Creating an output is usually followed by drm_output_attach_head() and drm_output_enable() to make use of it.

simplesect.para: The output, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Create a Weston writeback for a writeback connector.

detaileddescription.para: Given a DRM connector of type writeback, create a matching drm_writeback structure and add it to Weston's writeback list.

b
Weston backend structure
conn
DRM connector object of type writeback
0 on success, -1 on failure
Takes ownership of connector on success, not on failure.

briefdescription.para: Given the DRM connector object of a connector, create drm_head or drm_writeback object (depending on the type of connector) for it.

detaileddescription.para: The object is then added to the DRM-backend list of heads or writebacks.

briefdescription.para: Find all connectors of the fd and create drm_head or drm_writeback objects (depending on the type of connector they are) for each of them.

detaileddescription.para: These objects are added to the DRM-backend lists of heads and writebacks.

parameterdescription.para: The DRM resources, it is taken with drmModeGetResources

briefdescription.para: Handle KMS GPU being added/removed.

detaileddescription.para: If the device being added/removed is the KMS device, we activate/deactivate the compositor session.

parameterdescription.para: Whether the device is being added (or removed)

briefdescription.para: Determines whether or not a device is capable of modesetting.

detaileddescription.para: If successful, sets b->drm.fd and b->drm.filename to the opened device.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_keyboard *keyboard, const struct timespec *time, uint32_t key, void *data)
memberdef.name: planes_binding

memberdef.argsstring: (struct weston_keyboard *keyboard, const struct timespec *time, uint32_t key, void *data)
memberdef.name: recorder_binding
